text:
Hi guys, I'm Laura Vitale and on this episode
of of Laura in the Kitchen I want to show
you how to make delicious watermelon margaritas.
Is it groundbreaking?
No.
Is it difficult?
No.
Does it require a video?
Probably not.

But, but, whenever I show a recipe - whenever
I show myself drinking anything or having

anything on Instagram or anywhere really,
I get bombarded with questions about 'can
you make a recipe?

I love to have a place to go print and always
have them'

So this is my favorite watermelon margarita,
you can do the same thing with mango, and

it would be phenomenal, all you need is some
fresh watermelon.

Now I don't like this frozen, I like my watermelon
margarita on the rocks.

But if you're doing mango, use frozen mango,
because that - I'm weird, I like my mango

margaritas frozen, my watermelon margarita
on the rocks.
Don't ask, that's just what I prefer.

Then you'll need some really delicious quantro
or triple sec, any sort of orange liqueur

that would be great, if you want to do this
alcohol free, use orange juice.

Fresh lime juice, some silver tequila, if
you don't want to use tequila and you want

to make this no alcohol, then use a lemon
lime soda or something like that and it would
be great.

I've also got a lot of simple syrup because
I like my margaritas a little bit sweet.
I don't like them tart because whoo!

It already puts hair on my back, I don't want
it to be like really strong, so we're going
to make a watermelon juice.

All I do for this is I take my fresh watermelon,
look how red and sweet and wonderful that
is.
Going to pop that in there.

And I'm just going to put the lid on and let
it go until it turns into juice.

My oven's preheated for something else, which
you will see later.
It is done.

You want to strain this, just to make sure
it catches any bits of anything left behind

because again, you're looking for a watermelon
juice.
Nice and clear.
That is perfect.

If you're using really good sweet delicious
watermelon, then we will not have a need for

any additional sweetener but like I said,
I like it so that's what we do.

Then I just take about half of this, you can
make this as strong or as weak as you want
to.

I'm going to take about, you know what let's
take most of it, leave a little bit of it
behind.

And I'll take the rest of my liquor, add that
in there.

And I know that for me, I'm going to want
about a tablespoon of simple syrup, simple

syrup is nothing more than equal parts water
and sugar brought to a simmer just long enough

for the sugar to dissolve and then you go
ahead and let it cool and stick it in your

fridge and use it any time you need to sweeten
anything.

If you don't want to go through that trouble,
just use some agave nectar, it will be fine.

This is going to mix for just a second and
we're going to prep our glasses.
So your choices are salt or sugar.
I'm a salt person.

So you just rim the edges of your glass with
some lime.

And then you go ahead and do that same thing
with either salt or sugar, my husband would
do sugar, I do salt.

You know me, if you've known me for a long
time you know I'm a sucker for anything salty,
so this is definitely my choice.

Okay, not too much ice or you'll water it
down.
You know what I'm sayin'?
Nobody wants a watered down margarita.
Yes.
Yes.
How beautiful!

All I'm saying is this is wonderful but if
you want to go ahead and add a few leaves

of basil to this, I know what you're thinking,
I've lost it.

But I haven't, if you add a couple leaves
of basil to this, it just mixes with the watermelon
incredibly well.
You cannot even imagine.

So go ahead and do that, don't think I'm nuts,
just try it, it would be your new go-to drink.
Mmm.

You know, the world is a better place when
you're drinking a watermelon margarita.
That is perfect.
It is not too strong.
It is not too sweet.

It's not too acid, I mean it's just absolute
perfection, this is the recipe that I love
and that I build all my margaritas around.

Go to LauraintheKitchen.com, give it a try,
let me know how you like it, tag me on Instagram

so I can see you enjoy your margarita, cheers
to the weekend!
